comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0b8) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b8
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101209 Fedora/3.1.7-0.35.b3pre.fc14 Lightning/1.0b3pre Thunderbird/3.1.7

Even though the Address Book respects the "LC_LOCALE" when formating the date (which is great), when editing a contact, the fields are not in the same order, and this results a bit confusing.

In my case, I use ISO format, which is YYYY-MM-DD.  I know it's a bit wierd, since most people I know use DD-MM-YYYY, and I know USA uses MM-DD-YYYY.  I just use ISO format cause I'm pretty sure I'm not seening any of these two and getting mixed up myself (off topic :-P)

Dates in the address book display fine, but dates in the "edit contact" window are a bit confusing.

I have two text boxes, both empty, and then the year textbox, regardless of my locale.
It's a bit uncertain which text box is what (date or month), and I hesitate every time.

I think there are a couple of fixes for this that result in less doubt for users in general:

 - Move the text boxes around so they match the order in things are shown for the current LC_LOCALE (seems a bit of work, but really great solution).
 - Display a gray text saying "MM" and "DD" in the respective text-boxes.  This seems the easiest solution, and pretty much fixes the issue.
 - Use a pulldown/combo for months.  This might not respect LC_LOCALE as far as the order of the fields go, but, but would avoid mistakes.

Using the popup calendar can help, but it's pretty hard to open without using a mouse, and it may be tedious when updating several contacts.

Reproducible: Always

comments.text:
I agree with you that MM and DD in gray text should be displayed (just like year and age)

If pulldown/combo is used for month, it would be more logical to use it for day as well.  Personally, I don't find the date-picker very useful. I mean, I would not know in which day of the week a person is born, so displaying the days in week-order is useless for me.
